text:
Elsa "Happy birthday Anna, I've made you a
cake"

Anna "Oh Elsa it's beautiful, how'd you cook
that?
Elsa: Ann on YouTube showed me
Welcome to How To Cook That I am Ann Reardon

To make a frozen fever birthday cake you'll
need 3 sponge cakes cooled and leveled.

You can see the recipe video for them on the
howtocookthat.net website and the frosting
recipe quantities are there too.
And I'll put a ink in the description below.

We will leave one sponge cake full sized and
then we need three smaller cakes.

I'm going to use bowls to help me cut them
the right size.
Cut the middle sized one out first.

Then using the left over part of that sponge
cake cut out two pieces to make the smaller
circle cake.

Then cut around the bigger bowl so you end
up with four different sized cakes.

Seive the icing sugar or powdered sugar to
get rid of any lumps Then melt your butter
or margarine in the microwave.

Pour that into the icing sugar and mix it
through really well.

Now because the butter is not white it turns
your icing that yellowy colour.

If we addd blue to that we'll get green, we
don't want green.

So I am going to add some white food colouring
first and then some blue.

Once you are happy with that put that to one
side.

And in another bowl add your compound white
chocolate and some cream.

Now you want to heat that in the microwave
in 30 second bursts, stirring each time until
it is melted and smooth like this.

Then add the blue frosting to that and mix
the two together and your frosting is ready.

Put a small bowl or cup onto a plate and then
add one of your cakes on top.

Pour some warmed frosting over it and just
let it drip down the sides of the cake.

If there are gaps just add more frosting and
let it drip down.

Once it has cooled take a spatula and add
a bit more frosting around the edges just

to smooth it out - and we'll add another layer
in a moment.

Scrape up all that excess frosting that's
dripped onto the plates.
And warm it up again to make it liquid.

Then pour it through a sieve to get rid of
any cake crumbs that came off the cake when
you did that first layer.

Now we want the frosting to be warm enough
to be liquid but not hot or it's just going

to melt our first layer of frosting of the
cake.

Pour it over the top just like we did the
first time

And this second layer just helps to get the
frosting smooth, now it is not as smooth as

if you used a cold whipped frosting and spread
out using your spatula and leveled it.

But because this cake is so small and it has
so many details on it you are really not going
to see it anyway.
And this is just much quicker.

In the movie this is an ice cream cake, if
you want to make an icecream cake follow the

directions on the fault in our stars cake
video you can find that on youtube.com/howtocookthat
Once it is set trim off any drips.

And then stack your four cakes on top of each
other.

Now make up some royal icing and pipe it around
to cover the joins where the cake joins the
next one.

Just squeeze and drag go back squeeze stop
drag go back and and continue that for each
layer of cake.

Then using a small star shaped tip pipe little
stars around the top.

Start low and squeeze stop and pull up start
low squeeze stop pull up.

Add those around the top edge of each layer
of cake.
Now using a small round tip pipe semicircles.

Attach it at the top the pipe and pull away
from the cake letting the frosting just hang
down.

And then bring it back to the cake to join
it on again.

So you get a nice smooth semicircle when you
do that.

Once you've done that on each layer add some
yellow decorations, I am just using soft sugar
pearls that I purchased form the shop.

Now add some swirls of frosting around the
bottom layer.
A bit like drawing an s shape on its side.

And then using a toothpick mark where you
want you sunflowers to be.

Then pipe from the dot a curve going down,
up and around.

And continue that all the way around and then
on the next layer up do the same thing but
in the opposite direction.

Take some little chocolate drops and cut off
the top of it so you're left with a round
bit for the flower centers.

If you can't get chocolate drops in this size
that is fine just melt some chocolate and
pipe out little circles.

Using yellow buttercream and a star tip pipe
a flower on the side and add a chocolate circle
for the centre.

Squeeze out less frosting for the flowers
on the next layer up.

So they are a little bit smaller put them
all the way around the cake and then smaller
again on the top level.

Mix in a little blue to the left over yellow
frosting to make green and pipe on a leaf
next to each flower.
And pipe on a leaf next to each flower.

Now you can use a piping tip to do this or
I have a whole page on the website showing

how you can use just plastic bags to make
the tips like this so that you don't need
to buy the tips.

So you don't have the tips just click through
to the website to find that.
Now we just need to add a little snow.

Put something to the very top of the cake
to protect it and then using a tea strainer
sprinkle on some icing sugar.

Remove the cupcake liner and then add the
ice sculpture picture to the top using a toothpick.

You can print that out in this size from the
website.
Elsa "Do you like it"
Anna "Yes I love it"
Elsa "ahh choo"
Anna "bless you Elsa"
Anna "mmm yumm"
Elsa "ahchoo"

Elsa "thank you but you have a fever lets
get you to bed"

Subscribe to How To Cook That for more cakes
chocolates and desserts, click here to go
to the website for the recipes.

Here to go to the channel and here for the
elsa, cinderella or olaf.

Have a great week and I'll see you all on
Friday.
